reviews.title: Friendly Staff
reviews.text: I visited Cork at the end of May. After having too many pints of Murphy's I stumbled across Jurys Inn. That evening I had a wonderful experience talking with Lorin, Lorraine, and Nick. I went to Cork hoping to meet some friendly people and I was not having very good luck until I met these three. They made my experience in Cork very memorable. The next time I come to visit, I will stay at Jurys Inn. Thank you for a truly wonderful perception of Ireland.

reviews.title: Jurys Inn Cork
reviews.text: I have good and bad things to say about this hotel. The location of this hotel is GREAT, next to the river. Make sure you stay in a room with an " odd number" so you can have a river view.

reviews.title: nice place to stay
reviews.text: You can see they were short of staff when the Food and beverage manager was checking people in. The hotel had a nice lobby with a nice bar/restaurant. The food was really good, but the service was really really bad. The bartender was not rude or anything like that but he will be gone for a while, so make sure you have a full drink before he goes wherever he goes. People were waiting for drinks (including me) for more that 15 minutes.

reviews.title: not bad but just needs more attention
reviews.text: stayed here with my other half it was great i just found some staff did not give good attention to the customers need but overalll the hotel is fabulous well packaged and clean,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service was great and brill and breakfast was fabulous the barman was great he helped us with everything from taxis to tours thansk a lot jim
reviews.title: great location
Receptionist
reviews.text: I would recommend a stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights. Clean basic rooms. A little bit noisy at night but for young travellers on a budget that want a good location it's perfect.
reviews.title: Not for couples seeking quiet, not for business traveller, poor/basic facilities

likes.disliked: — cleanliness of room/bathroom, room facilities, noise for corridor/stag/hen parties, poor quality breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in Jurys Inn on the 16th of February 2008. I found the receptionist was in a complete daze. There was complimentary champagne with the book I had to ask the receptionist three times for it, in the end I had to ask the receptionist where I can pick up the champagne I ahd to go to the bar and get it by myself. I found the sevice very unprofessional.
reviews.title: ok
Irish travel inn
reviews.text: hotel reception nice and helpful - arranged to keep bags until our room was ready. Although a hen night checked in before us we heard no noise in the night - the receptionist even told us she would not give us a room with a connecting door as they tend to be noisier.

reviews.title: Expensive, Noisy and a weekend mecca for stag and hen do's
reviews.text: room was tidy and clean, tv worked, coffee + tea making facilities available.

reviews.title: Convenient and inexpensive
reviews.text: didn't try the food but there was lots of choice on the menu and the Bar was open all day for food and snacks.

reviews.title: Steer clear
reviews.text: the hotel is 2 minutes walk from the coach station, 5 minutes from the centre of town and 5 minutes from the train station. The shuttle bus from the airport has this hotel on it's route and a bus passes every 20 mins.

reviews.title: Facilities OK, but not great value for money
reviews.text: this hotel is functional, like a Travel lodge or travel inn. If you want high class with a high price stay at Jury's Hotel round the corner.
